# openAppWhenRun

**Type Property**

A boolean property that tells the system to consider the app intent even if its app is not in the foreground.

## Declaration

```swift
static var openAppWhenRun: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

This property is deprecated, use [doc://com.apple.AppIntents/documentation/AppIntents/AppIntent/supportedModes] instead. For backward compatibility, provide `openAppWhenRun` in an extension, for example:

```swift
@available(*, deprecated)
extension OrderSoupIntent {
    static var openAppWhenRun: Bool { true }
}
```

## Configuring the metadata

- **title**: A short, localized, human-readable string that describes the app intent using a verb and a noun in title case.
- **description**: A description of the app intent that the system shows to people.
- **isDiscoverable**: A boolean value that determines whether system features such as Shortcuts and Spotlight can discover this app intent.
